div.p:
SCOTT (John), an eminent Engliſh divine, was born in 1638, and became miniſter of St Thomas’s in Southwark. In 1684 he was collated to a prebend in the cathedral of St Paul’s. Dr Hiekes tells us, that, after the revolution, “ he firſt refuſed the biſhopric of Cheſter, becauſe he would not take the oath of ho-
mage; and afterwards another biſhopric, the deanery of Worcheſter, and a prebend of the church of Windſor, becauſe they were all places of deprived men.” He publiſhed ſeveral excellent works, particularly The Chriſtian Life, &c. and died in 1695. He was eminent for his humanity, affability, ſincerity, and readineſs to do good; and his talent for preaching was extraordinary.
